item.title: 'The Ego and The Id' By Sigmund Freud - Book Notes
item.description: “The Ego and the Id” (1923) is a prominent paper (also book) by Sigmund Freud, the founder of psychoanalysis. The book formulates the structural personality model in which he articulates a map of the different layers which comprise the human soul: the conscious, unconscious and preconscious which correlate with the faculties of ego, id and super-ego. Captures Chapter 1: Consciousness and What is Unconscious ‘Being conscious’ is in the first place a purely descriptive term, resting on perception of the most immediate and certain character.

item.title: 'The Liberation of Sita' By Volga - Book Notes
item.description: Thoughts Does Ramayana qualify for a feminist fiction? For argument’s sake, lets consider Ramayana is a true story. Post Ram and Sita’s homecoming, Sita was asked to give a chastity test, and she left the palace after proving herself. She could have left without undergoing the test but then the crowd would have believed that indeed she was at fault. Being a woman and fighting for yourself in those ages is feministic (and applause worthy).

​ 26/07/2022 Panvel’s heritage spots and legacy 25/07/2022 Gary Vee’s book notes tripping on saraab by samar atlassian founders’ journey - twitter thread 24/07/2022 tripping on ek album by faridkot vfx -> motion capture is hard garmi ki chutti - standup kaala jaadu - standup - munawar most laughs were common tropes jokes were okayish, expectations was high with munawar mumbaikars - lifelesson 23/07/2022 nice problem, great video: infinite rooms <> infinte guests how did i land on this: vfx artists reaction bollywood scenes crypto 101 - gotta complete this 22/07/2022

item.title: Seven Deadly Sins
item.description: The way we behave is mostly influenced by our surroundings (by law of averages you shall become average of folks you spend time with, over a long period of time) until and unless we mindfully start tweaking these behaviours. Here, as the title suggests, I write about these conventional vices with the aim to define/understand them better, most of which are the basis of our sufferings. The seven deadly sins, also known as the capital vices or cardinal sins, is a grouping and classification of vices within Christian teachings.

item.title: 'Parasyte' By Hitoshi Iwaaki - Book Notes
item.description: Parasyte is a manga/anime that deals on some pretty heavy subjects regarding the existence of humans. Thoughts Are humans parasytes? Favourite Moments This scene in chapter-48, it was a powerful scene. The arc seems to complete here

item.title: Intention Vs Action - framework to prioritise yourself
item.description: ​ Whenever we are hurt/harmed or have been at the end of an unsatisfying or unfavourable situation, we replay the situation and try to judge each and every action, of ourselves and of others. We often reflect upon the incident from various lenses. There are frameworks to better understand and analyse your/others’ actions, one such framework that has helped me to judge these situations is “Intention Vs Action”. ​ Why Intention Vs Action?

item.title: 'Ghachar Ghochar' By Vivek Shanbhag - Book Notes
item.description: A look into the lives of an Indian household with all its perjudices and beautiful memories. Captures someone who simply sits there for so long must have a thousand wheels spinning in his head. ‘Sir – one story, many sides.’ Words after all are nothing by themselves. They burst into meaning only in the minds they’ve entered. At times, I’m tempted to unburden myself to him. But then, what’s the point when he seems to know without being told?

item.title: 'Animal Farm' By George Orwell - Book Notes
item.description: The book is a satire on Communism. Fun Facts It was written between 1943 and 1945, and since Britain, US and Soviet Union had good relations, majority publication houses refused to publish the book. Summary Chapter 1: After Mr. Jones, the owner of Manor Farm, falls asleep in a drunken stupor, all of his animals meet in the big barn at the request of old Major, a 12-year-old pig. Major delivers a rousing political speech about the evils inflicted upon them by their human keepers and their need to rebel against the tyranny of Man.

​ 04/11/2021 Dune https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_UM3Lhj9Ywk https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yhYU4ZbLmmk 22/09/2021 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=83iZ68s-9YE Farm Laws India 2020 - Documentary https://dev.to/codesphere/should-i-use-sqlite-postgresql-or-mysql-1o4b 20/09/2021 https://moontowermeta.com/the-most-important-solutions-are-simple-just-not-easy/ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VmbSpTJXozk we hire products to do the job for us https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eJ07g2NtOiY decomplication: the art of first principles thinking www.paulgraham.com/mean.html meanness and success are inversely correlated (PG admits there might be selection bias here) for most of history success meant control of scarce resources this is changing, increasingly the games that matter are not zero-sum being mean makes you stupid, makes you fight, and in turn drains your energy mean founders struggle with hiring best people (since best people have better options and mean founders cant convince to join them) 03/09/2021

item.title: 'The Count Of Monte Cristo' - Book Notes
item.description: In 2019, a colleague, with similar appetite as mine, recommended me to read ‘The Count of Monte Cristo’ describing it as the best revenge story there is, and after deliberating on it for some time, I finally took the plunge. The book is not yet complete, but will keep adding my thoughts and notes here. ​ Thoughts on the book Hard vocabulary - The book is from centuries back and people spoke and wrote in a different form.

item.title: 'The Cathedral and The Bazaar' By Eric S. Raymond - Book Notes
item.description: The Cathedral and the Bazaar (abbreviated CatB) Musings on Linux and Open Source by an Accidental Revolutionary is an essay, and later a book, by Eric S. Raymond Focal points: Every good work of software starts by scratching a developer's personal itch. Too often software developers spend their days grinding away for pay at programs they neither need nor love To solve an interesting problem, start by finding a problem that is interesting to you.

item.title: Introduction to Elm with 2048 game
item.description: ​ In this post I will be creating a small game, 2048 in Elm. 2048 is a game created by gabrielecirulli which went viral in 2014. I chose 2048 because the game mechanics are simple which will help us understand Elm clearly. Also, I didn’t want to make another todo app. You can play here. ​ The Game Mechanics? There are some number tiles on the board (4x4). The number on the tile will be a power of 2 with minimum being 2.

item.title: Save the production with Nginx hack
item.description: ​ Quick nginx hack to save your production web server in case the web service starts crashing. If you have been working in a production environment, you know at certain times your web service can crash due to some unknown reason (code failure). It will take some time to do the RCA and fix the issue. A quick hack is to have multiple web services running on different ports resp. that can take the load off if any of them goes down.

item.title: 'The Art of War' By Sun Tzu - Book Notes
item.description: Summary Calculation When you encounter a conflict in your life, before you act, seek out a solitary place that balances and enhances your mind to spiritually think things through. Face the conflict and pro-actively seek to understand what lies at its root. An enemy or adversary is someone who seeks to do you harm. You and your family no doubt have disagreements, but everyone works for the same goals. You don’t want to subdue those you love and care about; you want to support them.

item.title: Beautiful Quotes
item.description: ​ Impatience with actions, patience with results. – Naval ​ Your heart needs to break multiple times for it to open up. – Rumi ​ Education is not the learning of facts, but the training of the mind to think – Albert Einstein ​ And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music. – Friedrich Nietzsche ​ Somewhere in the process of maturing into adults, most humans misunderstood comfort for happiness.

item.description: ​ words link-log travel-checklist quotes

item.title: standup comedy
item.description: ​ With the advent of Internet, the meme culture and standup comedy culture has blasted in the last few years. Internet has not only enabled the reach via social networks, People could try out different material not only cheaply but also with the ease of a click. The showoff of facebook check-ins and instagram stories have acted as catalyst in the expansion of the gig culture. Good gags (likeness is subjective):

item.title: Travel Checklist
item.description: ​ Pre-travel checklist Download music on mobile (network unavailablility preparedness) Mobile recharge (talktime, internet), check and confirm availability of network Charge every device (electricity) Make credit card payments Cash in hand ATM cards and pins Necessary printouts (if required) Booking tickets (stay, travelling, if required) Research itineraries (local) Packing ​ Things to carry Hike/Travel: snacks (eatery) snickers dry fruits glucose small bag (quechua) sleeping eye cover neck pillow water bottle hygiene, skincare sunscreen brush and small toothpaste hand soap tissue roll lip balm hand sanitizer small towel gadgets power bank camera headphones clothing/accessories sunglasses/cap medicines crocin (fever/bodyache) loperamide (diarrhoea/loose motions) saradon (headache) ondem (vomiting/motion sickness) levocet (running nose) moov spray (pain relief spray) bandaides

item.title: Words
item.description: ​ Alone Living alone teaches you the importance of someone’s company ​ Anger memory of pain in the past messenger that shows you that something important to you is being betrayed, squashed, or overlooked. A boundary, a value, a desire. Don’t kill (supress) that messenger (ofcourse don’t react). best remedy is to delay (any reaction) understand the source, when you get irritated, write and explain the feelings, it might help in identifying the source ​
